intro: Omalotheca hoppeana subsp. magellensis, commonly known as the Magellanic omalotheca, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
